title: Oil prices jump as recent sharp falls draw investors
text: Oil prices rose more than $1 on Tuesday as the recent sharp falls due to the coronavirus pandemic encouraged bargain hunters to come forward, although the market remains volatile as the spread of the infection disrupts economies and hurts demand.

title: Asian stocks fall in volatile session after historic Wall St. plunge
text: Asian shares fell on Tuesday in a topsy-turvy session following one of Wall Street's biggest one-day routs in history as headlines about the coronavirus outbreak and its global economic impact whiplashed investor sentiment.

title: Here's what else the Fed can do, according to economist William Lee

title: Fed will pull out big guns to make sure there's no collapse: Banking analyst
text: CNBC's Kelly Evans talks with Gerard Cassidy, managing director and banking analyst at RBC Capital Markets, and Peter Boockvar of Bleakley Advisory Group, about the market sell-off amid the coronavirus outbreak and the Fed's new initiative in an effort to calm market tumult.

title: Markets wanted targeted stimulus: Investing expert
text: CNBC's Kelly Evans talks with Barry James of James Investment Research; Darrell Cronk of Wells Fargo Investment Institute; and Peter Boockvar of Bleakley Advisory Group, about the ongoing market sell-off amid the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Oil prices jumped $1 as recent sharp falls draw investors
text: Oil prices rose more than $1 on Tuesday as the recent sharp falls due to the coronavirus pandemic encouraged bargain hunters to come forward, although the market remains volatile as the spread of the infection disrupts economies and hurts demand.

title: Historic Fed Action Doesn’t Placate Markets
text: Yesterday, the Fed took massive action toward curbing the impact of the coronavirus, yet as I write Monday, markets are in a freefall. Here’s what our analysts are saying   Yesterday, the Federal Reserve took an historical step by slashing its target rate to essentially zero (now at 0% – 0.25%), and launching a massive.

title: How the New Worst Trading Days Since the 1987 Crash Stack Up, and How to Curb the Market Mayhem
text: What is unfolding in the wake of the coronavirus-induced economic panic is starting to feel like a runaway train.

title: Raghuram Rajan discusses central banks, coronavirus, and helping stressed businesses and households
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan joins On the Move to discuss what the emergency rate cut by the Federal Reserve means for markets, how central banks and governments can help businesses and households that are stressed, and the importance of creating the right environment for a recovery.

title: Sell-Off to Deepen in Asia
text: Asia investors will be eyeing the risk-off baton handed over by the U.S. after the S&P 500’s worst plunge since 1987. Bloomberg’s Andreea Papuc reports on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: Oil Market Facing More Than Just a Price War: Nasdaq's Essner
text: Tamar Essner, director of energy and utilities at Nasdaq, discusses the outlook for oil amid the price-war between Saudi Arabia and Russia, and the implications for energy companies.

title: Fed Liquidity Actions Could Be Strengthened, Broaddus Says
text: Former Richmond Federal Reserve President Alfred Broaddus discusses how the coronavirus outbreak is affecting the U.S. economy, monetary and fiscal policies. The Fed swept into action in a new bid to save the economy, cutting its benchmark interest rate by a full percentage point to near zero and pledging to boost its bond holdings by at least $700 billion. Broaddus speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia."

title: Asian stocks fall after historic Wall Street rout
text: Most Asian shares fell on Tuesday a day after Wall Street's historic market rout, with fleeting initial gains evaporating  as the coronavirus remained a major risk to economic growth.

title: Guggenheim's Minerd: I see this getting much worse on a fundamental level
text: Guggenheim's Scott Minerd discusses the markets and the latest action taken by the Fed.

title: This Is How Long The Bear Market Is Likely To Last
text: Investors find this market crash hard to understand because it is fundamentally different from previous crashes in that it has been engineered on purpose to fight COVID-19. That also opens the way for a swift recovery once the spread is contained.

title: Stocks fall nearly 13%, some are calling it a new 'Black Monday'
text: Yahoo Finance's Andy Serwer, Seana Smith and Dan Roberts discuss the  Dow dropping 13% on Monday March 16, 2020.

title: El-Erian: We have the alignment of four negative factors at once
text: Mohamed El-Erian, Allianz, discusses the Fed's moves and whether it's enough to have an impact on the markets.

title: Another black Monday as coronavirus response upends Wall Street
text: Wall Street suffered its biggest drop since the crash of 1987 on Monday after unprecedented steps taken by the Federal Reserve, lawmakers and the White House to slow the spread and blunt the economic hit of the coronavirus failed to restore order to markets.

title: Jim Cramer says forget index funds, buy shares in companies 'we can't live without'
text: As the global economy slows, stick to the quality recession-roof stocks when they come down, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: America’s Economy Begins to Shut Down as Pandemic Measures Take Hold
text: The fast-spreading virus has put an end to movies, date nights and other economic activity, prompting some economists to call a U.S. recession.

title: U.S. stock futures tick up after Monday's plunge on Wall Street
text: U.S. stock futures ticked up late Monday, following Wall Street's worst day since the 1987 crash.

title: Dow futures up following another record point drop Monday
text: Stock futures were up slightly Monday evening, a tentative rebound following another painful day for the market caused by coronavirus fears.

title: The markets need to know how big the problem is: Bianco
text: Jim Bianco of Bianco research on the Fed's moves and whether it needs to do more. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and Fast Money trader Steve Grasso.

text: With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and Fast Money trader Guy Adami.

title: US stock futures rise slightly following Dow's third-worst day ever
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 had their worst day since the "Black Monday" crash of 1987, falling 12.9% and 12%, respectively.

title: Video: How to Invest in This Volatile Market
text: GuruFocus founder Charlie Tian walks us through some considerations for a difficult to predict market.

title: ETF Edge: Tom Lydon Talks Volatility, Uncertainty, And Bonds
text: There’s no way around it, CNBC’s Bob Pisani opens this week’s ETF Edge with news that the ETF market is delivering head-spinning market gyrations. There have been significant drops interspersed with big rallies throughout the past week.

title: The Fed Cut 100 And The Market Freaked Out – Here’s Why
text: The Fed cut 100 basis points in a surprise easing, yet the market tanked.

text: The U.S. stock market continued its plunge Monday amid fears of a global recession due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

text: Renaissance's Macro Research's Neil Dutta explains the Federal Reserve's move to quantitative easing.

title: Virus Destruction Continues As Dow Falls 3,000 Points
text: Experts believe the virus will peak in the U.S. sometime between the end of April and the middle of May.

title: Coronavirus is hitting the economy worse than Wall Street thinks, investor Rich Bernstein warns
text: An Institutional Investor Hall of Famer believes the markets won't bottom until there's "complete disbelief."

title: Wall Street's fear gauge closes at highest level ever, surpassing even financial crisis peak
text: A measure of fear in stocks just topped the levels during the financial crisis more than a decade ago.

title: Markets crater as coronavirus fears overwhelm central bank emergency measures
text: Markets reeled on Monday, with stocks on Wall Street and the price of Brent crude tumbling more than 10%, as the Federal Reserve's second emergency rate cut in as many weeks failed to calm fears of a coronavirus-induced recession.

title: Fiscal stimulus the ticket: Former Federal Reserve governor
text: Sarah Bloom Raskin, former Federal Reserve governor and Rubenstein Fellow at Duke University, discusses recent Fed moves to stem economic disaster due to the coronavirus.

text: Tematica Research Chief Macro Strategist Lenore Hawkins breaks down the spread of COVID-19 in Italy.
